commit_message:
Add get_by_network() to FixedIPList

This adds support for get_by_network() to FixedIPList, which is needed
by the linux_net module to go full-objects. Since it depends on
information in the VirtualInterface object, this also adds a nested
FixedIP.virtual_interface object, which currently is only reachable
when queried in this way.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I6b53e6eed1dee049a51d95f385132fc28c7cce05
Related-bug: 1290568
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/79714/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import virtual_interface as vif_obj # Version 1.1: Added virtual_interface field VERSION = '1.1' 'virtual_interface': fields.ObjectField('VirtualInterface', nullable=True), if field == 'virtual_interface': # NOTE(danms): This field is only set when doing a # FixedIPList.get_by_network() because it's a relatively # special-case thing, so skip it here continue # Version 1.1: Added get_by_network() VERSION = '1.1' '1.1': '1.1', def get_by_network(cls, context, network, host=None): ipinfo = db.network_get_associated_fixed_ips(context, network['id'], host=host) if not ipinfo: return [] fips = cls(context=context, objects=[]) for info in ipinfo: inst = instance_obj.Instance(context=context, uuid=info['instance_uuid'], hostname=info['instance_hostname'], created_at=info['instance_created'], updated_at=info['instance_updated']) vif = vif_obj.VirtualInterface(context=context, id=info['vif_id'], address=info['vif_address']) fip = FixedIP(context=context, address=info['address'], instance_uuid=info['instance_uuid'], network_id=info['network_id'], virtual_interface_id=info['vif_id'], allocated=info['allocated'], leased=info['leased'], instance=inst, virtual_interface=vif) fips.objects.append(fip) fips.obj_reset_changes() return fips @obj_base.remotable_classmethod

commit_message:
Update qpid attributes

This change finishes off bp use-data-bag-for-qpid-password by removing
the unnecessary qpid attribute and defaulting qpid username to the same
value as openstack.mq.user.

Change-Id: I3ee99989c54fcda746eacb5c38011308494dc394
Implements: blueprint use-data-bag-for-qpid-password

This change reworked the ceph-related specs, now that ceph_client is
available in openstack-common.

Change-Id: Ib3a77b17bd3f5b899b1fb704ce7084982aa45b54

commit_message:
don't leave ourselves inside git directories

to ensure that we don't accidentally do the wrong thing to the
wrong git directory, make sure we return to the original directory
after doing a checkout.

Change-Id: I15d97bee86388f12ee1768123cd8fece78157ba6

commit_message:
disconnect novnc from gitbase

It turns out that grenade sets gitbase, however some of our
repositories don't have git.openstack.org repos. This causes a
really interesting failure case with grenade because novnc checkout
fails, then it does a checkout to master of nova.

Change-Id: I820b661dacee019928200935ae10d1e36d7b821b

commit_message:
Remove the RDO yum repo only when it does exist.

Co-Authored-By: Ionut Artarisi <iartarisi@suse.cz>
Change-Id: Ic43477ea9929c47ac0ea60b91d90bcc48e42420e
Closes-Bug: #1289142
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/72/78872/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: repo_action = nil elsif File.exist? "/etc/yum.repos.d/RDO-#{node['openstack']['release']}.repo" unless repo_action.nil? yum_repository "RDO-#{node['openstack']['release']}" do description "OpenStack RDO repo for #{node['openstack']['release']}" gpgkey node['openstack']['yum']['repo-key'] baseurl node['openstack']['yum']['uri'] enabled true action repo_action end
deleted_lines: else yum_repository "RDO-#{node['openstack']['release']}" do description "OpenStack RDO repo for #{node['openstack']['release']}" gpgkey node['openstack']['yum']['repo-key'] baseurl node['openstack']['yum']['uri'] enabled true action repo_action

commit_message:
Add hostname to stats

As Murano has multi-service deployment it is
necessary to add hostname to each stats
in order to understand which API service
provides them.

Change-Id: I9770e37fa7c230c8736280d966efe4b13b6e616e
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/09/79209/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import socket self._hostname = socket.gethostname()

commit_message:
Add DB model for stats

This patch adds a new DB model to keep API stats in the DB.
As it is possible to have multiple Murano API servers
we will keep stats for each Murano API instance

Change-Id: I6378add08ea5e26885b183c039a86f01ee168992
Partly-Implements: blueprint api-request-stats

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import schema as s from sqlalchemy import types as t meta = s.MetaData() def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine stats = s.Table( 'apistats', meta, s.Column('id', t.Integer(), primary_key=True), s.Column('host', t.String(80)), s.Column('request_count', t.BigInteger()), s.Column('error_count', t.BigInteger()), s.Column('average_response_time', t.Float()), s.Column('request_per_tenant', t.Text()), s.Column('request_per_second', t.Float()), s.Column('error_per_second', t.Float())) stats.create() def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta.bind = migrate_engine stats = s.Table('apistats', meta, autoload=True) stats.drop()

subject: Rename --timeout global option and make it work
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-10 23:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/http.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_common_http.py', 'heatclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient/commit/38098938be46998b651060c81fa92a9ecad562f6', 'message': "Rename --timeout global option and make it work

The --timeout option doesn't work for standalone use-cases when
you specify no-client-auth, and it's also confusing since it's
easily misinterpreted as an option related to the heat timeouts
provided to stack-create and in future stack-update.

So take this opportunity to rename the option to --api-timeout,
which hopefully more accurately reflects it's purpose, and don't
pass a default (just let requests use the global default socket
timeout) as it seems relatively unlikely users will wait for 10
minutes before pressing Ctrl-C on interactive shell requests.

Change-Id: I52480f0d128735bf5f312fc88f4078f27717baf2
Partial-Bug: #1290456
"}]
commit_message:
Rename --timeout global option and make it work

The --timeout option doesn't work for standalone use-cases when
you specify no-client-auth, and it's also confusing since it's
easily misinterpreted as an option related to the heat timeouts
provided to stack-create and in future stack-update.

So take this opportunity to rename the option to --api-timeout,
which hopefully more accurately reflects it's purpose, and don't
pass a default (just let requests use the global default socket
timeout) as it seems relatively unlikely users will wait for 10
minutes before pressing Ctrl-C on interactive shell requests.

Change-Id: I52480f0d128735bf5f312fc88f4078f27717baf2
Partial-Bug: #1290456

commit_message:
Switch to unsafe cache mode for test VMs.

We have no precious data in these in general. They are explicitly a
testbed for folk without access to baremetal. Making the cache be
unsafe saves about 5m on a CI test run (and will reduce sync pressure
for local development too).

Change-Id: I1b91b399f872adf973836326bf3d303287c98f66

commit_message:
Use os-svc-restart in boot-stack reset-db

This allows us to use map-services to make sure we use the correct
name instead of ||'ing together restart commands.

Change-Id: I42947bbb4f9be20803f540db3e14c19c6bd45755

commit_message:
Allow marconi-server to properly daemonize

This patch allows marconi-server to properly detach from the controlling terminal and daemonize.

Change-Id: Ib6eabf8c44c5526ea71f913908bf2d4d37c06511
Closes-Bug: #1287490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/86/79986/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Open /dev/zero and /dev/null for redirection. zerofd = os.open('/dev/zero', os.O_RDONLY) nullfd = os.open('/dev/null', os.O_WRONLY) # Close the stdthings and reassociate them with a non terminal os.dup2(zerofd, 0) os.dup2(nullfd, 1) os.dup2(nullfd, 2) # Detach process context, this requires 2 forks. try: pid = os.fork() if pid > 0: os._exit(0) except OSError, ex: os._exit(1) try: pid = os.fork() if pid > 0: os._exit(0) except OSError, ex: os._exit(2)

commit_message:
Add the install_rally.sh file

The install_rally.sh file is a Bash script that installs Rally on a
Unix system. Specifically, it is able to install and configure Rally
either globally (system-wide, the default behavior), or isolated in a
virtual environment using the virtualenv tool.

Change-Id: I4b6498a52cb1105fd8e27593ac482038ddcff702
Implements: blueprint rally-installation-script
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/25/76925/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # # This script installs Rally. # Specifically, it installs and configures Rally inside # a virtual envirnoment using the virtualenv tool. # # NOTE: The script assumes that you have the following # programs already installed: # -> Python 2.6 or Python 2.7 # -> cURL # -> git # Dependencies of cryptography: # -> GNU Compiler Collection # -> libffi # -> python-devel # -> openssl-devel # If you find that you miss one of the above programs, # please install it with your favorite package manager. # For example, for the dependencies of cryptography: # RHEL-based: yum install gcc libffi-devel python-devel openssl-devel # Debian-based: apt-get install build-essential libssl-dev libffi-dev python-dev # You may change the values of the following variables ############################################################ RALLY_VIRTUALENV="$HOME/venv-rally" RALLY_DATABASE="${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/database" GETPIPPY_FILE="/tmp/get-pip.py" ############################################################ RALLY_REPOSITORY="https://github.com/stackforge/rally.git" PIP_SECURE_LOCATION="https://raw.github.com/pypa/pip/master/contrib/get-pip.py" err() { echo "[$(date +'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')]: $@" >&2 } check_root() { user=$(/usr/bin/id -u) if [ ${user} -ne 0 ]; then err "Only the superuser (uid 0) can use this program." exit 1 fi } install_system_requirements() { curl -o ${GETPIPPY_FILE} ${PIP_SECURE_LOCATION} python ${GETPIPPY_FILE} pip install virtualenv } setup_virtualenv() { virtualenv ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV} source ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/bin/activate } install_rally_requirements() { pip install pbr pip install 'tox<=1.6.1' } install_rally() { git clone ${RALLY_REPOSITORY} ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/rally cd ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/rally python setup.py install } configure_rally() { #TODO(tzabal): Consider using sudo instead of requiring root mkdir ${RALLY_DATABASE} mkdir -p /etc/rally cp ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/rally/etc/rally/rally.conf.sample /etc/rally/rally.conf line=$(grep -n '#connection=sqlite' /etc/rally/rally.conf | cut -d : -f 1) line=$((${line}+1)) sed -i "${line}i connection=sqlite:////${RALLY_DATABASE}/\$sqlite_db" /etc/rally/rally.conf rally-manage db recreate } print_notice() { echo "======================================================================" echo "Before every Rally session, activate the virtualenv of Rally:" echo "source ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/bin/activate" echo "" echo "You may put the following in your ~/.bashrc file for convenience:" echo "alias initrally='source ${RALLY_VIRTUALENV}/bin/activate'" echo "======================================================================" } main() { check_root if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then exit 1; fi install_system_requirements setup_virtualenv install_rally_requirements install_rally configure_rally print_notice exit 0 } main "$@"

Closes-Bug: #1291482

commit_message:
Fix string format used to report content validation errors

The format used ('{!s}') was not compatible with Python 2.6. Replaced
this format with ('{0}').

Change-Id: Iab252cf867f16e4da354d9634d8ae4712fefb77e
Closes-Bug: #1291482

commit_message:
Fix and enable import checks

This patch fixes and enables:
* F401 unused imports
* H301 one import per line
* H302 import only modules
* H306 imports not in alphabetical order

Change-Id: I6f7f92004844184dc4bbea8c3a1ddfc196310b39

commit_message:
Mention tox as a prereq

grenade uses tox to run the tempest smoke tests, but doesn't do anything
to install it.

Change-Id: I8c23cde0f0d225384d7c40666b48107c23305bb4

commit_message:
Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Change-Id: Ie894ad386990794d270ca1cb72f40095bd40c2e6
Closes-Bug: 1288927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/36/78736/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.0.8 - Fix detach issue for multiple hosts Bug #1288927 VERSION = "2.0.8" vluns = self.client.getHostVLUNs(hostname) vlun = None for vlun in vluns: if vlun['active'] and volume_name in vlun['volumeName']: break if vlun is None: msg = (_("3PAR vlun %(name)s not found on host %(host)s") % {'name': volume_name, 'host': hostname}) raise exception.NotFound(message=msg)

subject: Retry logic for SSH connection in Cloud Server resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-03 19:30:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/4686b612fc1a714ead640dfd2d1ba0b74dac454f', 'message': "Keep trying to get SSH transport for up to 30 sec

There is a known issue with Rackspace's CentOS 6.5 image where it
occasionally refuses SSH connections for a few seconds just after
becoming 'ACTIVE'.  This causes the stack creation to fail.

To avoid this, keep trying to initialize the SSH connection for up to 30
seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1287331
Change-Id: Icf28fb3c0de21cf733c4dd0d28a7b653af1bcd0b

commit_message:
Retry logic for SSH connection in Cloud Server resource

There is a known issue with some Rackspace Cloud Server images where
they occasionally refuse SSH connections for a few seconds just after
becoming 'ACTIVE'.  This causes the stack creation to fail.

To avoid this, keep trying to initialize the SSH connection for up to 30
TaskRunner cycles.

Closes-Bug: #1287331
Change-Id: Icf28fb3c0de21cf733c4dd0d28a7b653af1bcd0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/77/77677/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventletimport time def get_transport(): retry_until = time.time() + 30 while time.time() < retry_until: try: return paramiko.Transport((self.server.accessIPv4, 22)) except paramiko.SSHException: logger.debug("Failed to get SSH transport, will retry") eventlet.sleep(1) raise exception.Error(_("Failed to get SSH transport after 30s")) transport = get_transport()

commit_message:
Revert "Adding image multiple location support"

This reverts commit a55bbbfa1957d02b3006a51afcf4984a1f8ff886.

The series of patches involved with adding this feature introduced
an unexpected dependency on glance's v2 API, which we do not
currently support. Triggering a user-facing bug quickly, and leaving
some uncertainty about what else is likely to come in the future,
a revert of this code was decided given the short time to -rc1.

Closes-bug: 1291014
Change-Id: I2ed6a861e583b9513b0984ff9801d4b9f7536798

commit_message:
Revert "Move libvirt RBD utilities to a new file"

This reverts commit cb8968400f8c8370cab309de0f63e82565bfb25b.

The series of patches involved with adding this feature introduced
an unexpected dependency on glance's v2 API, which we do not
currently support. Triggering a user-facing bug quickly, and leaving
some uncertainty about what else is likely to come in the future,
a revert of this code was decided given the short time to -rc1.

Change-Id: I5e5d897f7294a7d4bda76ed392f503d0552f45e9
Related-bug: 1291014

added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import jsonutils try: import rados import rbd except ImportError: rados = None rbd = None class RBDVolumeProxy(object): """Context manager for dealing with an existing rbd volume. This handles connecting to rados and opening an ioctx automatically, and otherwise acts like a librbd Image object. The underlying librados client and ioctx can be accessed as the attributes 'client' and 'ioctx'. """ def __init__(self, driver, name, pool=None): client, ioctx = driver._connect_to_rados(pool) try: self.volume = driver.rbd.Image(ioctx, str(name), snapshot=None) except driver.rbd.Error: LOG.exception(_("error opening rbd image %s"), name) driver._disconnect_from_rados(client, ioctx) raise self.driver = driver self.client = client self.ioctx = ioctx def __enter__(self): return self def __exit__(self, type_, value, traceback): try: self.volume.close() finally: self.driver._disconnect_from_rados(self.client, self.ioctx) def __getattr__(self, attrib): return getattr(self.volume, attrib) def ascii_str(s): """Convert a string to ascii, or return None if the input is None. This is useful when a parameter is None by default, or a string. LibRBD only accepts ascii, hence the need for conversion. """ if s is None: return s return str(s) self.ceph_conf = ascii_str(CONF.libvirt.images_rbd_ceph_conf) self.rbd_user = ascii_str(CONF.libvirt.rbd_user) self.rbd = kwargs.get('rbd', rbd) self.rados = kwargs.get('rados', rados) def _connect_to_rados(self, pool=None): client = self.rados.Rados(rados_id=self.rbd_user, conffile=self.ceph_conf) try: client.connect() pool_to_open = str(pool or self.pool) ioctx = client.open_ioctx(pool_to_open) return client, ioctx except self.rados.Error: # shutdown cannot raise an exception client.shutdown() raise def _disconnect_from_rados(self, client, ioctx): # closing an ioctx cannot raise an exception ioctx.close() client.shutdown() def _supports_layering(self): return hasattr(self.rbd, 'RBD_FEATURE_LAYERING') def _ceph_args(self): args = [] if self.rbd_user: args.extend(['--id', self.rbd_user]) if self.ceph_conf: args.extend(['--conf', self.ceph_conf]) return args def _get_mon_addrs(self): args = ['ceph', 'mon', 'dump', '--format=json'] + self._ceph_args() out, _ = utils.execute(*args) lines = out.split('\n') if lines[0].startswith('dumped monmap epoch'): lines = lines[1:] monmap = jsonutils.loads('\n'.join(lines)) addrs = [mon['addr'] for mon in monmap['mons']] hosts = [] ports = [] for addr in addrs: host_port = addr[:addr.rindex('/')] host, port = host_port.rsplit(':', 1) hosts.append(host.strip('[]')) ports.append(port) return hosts, ports hosts, ports = self._get_mon_addrs() def _resize(self, volume_name, size): size = int(size) * units.Ki with RBDVolumeProxy(self, volume_name) as vol: vol.resize(size) def create_image(self, prepare_template, base, size, *args, **kwargs): if self.rbd is None: raise RuntimeError(_('rbd python libraries not found')) if self._supports_layering(): args += self._ceph_args() self._resize(self.rbd_name, size)

commit_message:
Revert "enable cloning for rbd-backed ephemeral disks"

This reverts commit c25c60f6a9ab1ccf12f72f76d400e7c9c0d090b3.

The series of patches involved with adding this feature introduced
an unexpected dependency on glance's v2 API, which we do not
currently support. Triggering a user-facing bug quickly, and leaving
some uncertainty about what else is likely to come in the future,
a revert of this code was decided given the short time to -rc1.

Change-Id: Iee835652f56beed1b8ac74d782e34a5238102840
Related-bug: 1291014

commit_message:
Adding domain to context

Add support for upcoming "domain" concept in Keystone V3 API in
the context.

This fix ensures there is a user_identity in the context for the
corresponding new attribute in the log format string added in oslo. The
oslo change has the same change-id as this one.

Closes-Bug: #1290503
Change-Id: Ic2cf3e52cfcc0b8adccdf9c59afaa4014708a303

commit_message:
Fix problem of deleting dhcp port

when network is deleted, the dhcp port in that network will be deleted
automaticly, so '_cleanup_ports' should not clean dhcp port. I already
have a patch to fix the problem of deleting dhcp port.

Change-Id: I92f90a3dad6d76954d466e4b30ab7c46434ba7df
Closes-bug: #1279683

commit_message:
Improve readability of test_networks

* Use list comprehension where it makes sense.

* Remove redundant assertions. That is, assertions in some tests that
  are really the responsibility of another test. For example, checking
  if a given network id is present in a list was being checked in both
  test_list_networks and test_list_networks_fields.

* Create assertEmpty and assertNotEmpty methods to help further clarify
  the intent of certain assertions.

Change-Id: Id91b2d2b6699eaf4acc332b3e76f9cb46c09d7c7

commit_message:
purge packages between integration tests

Otherwise cuttlefish won't be installed if emperor is already there,
which defeats the purpose of integration tests.

Change-Id: I1bf3a8aa9ae3447d424a70e97b57b4f63cf29228
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/59/79059/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: purge = <<-EOS package { 'python-ceph': ensure => purged; 'ceph-common': ensure => purged; 'librados2': ensure => purged; 'librbd1': ensure => purged; } EOS it 'should purge all packages' do puppet_apply(purge) do |r| r.exit_code.should_not == 1 end end it 'should purge all packages' do puppet_apply(purge) do |r| r.exit_code.should_not == 1 end end it 'should purge all packages' do puppet_apply(purge) do |r| r.exit_code.should_not == 1 end end it 'should purge all packages' do [ 'first', 'second' ].each do |mon| puppet_apply(:node => "#{mon}", :code => purge) do |r| r.exit_code.should_not == 1 end end end

commit_message:
Merge Block Storage into Overcloud

This patch removes the seperate overcloud-with-block-storage.yaml
make target and merges the functionality into the main overcloud.yaml
target.  The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 0. Change this number to add
additional block storage nodes.

This patch also updates the overcloud-with-block-storage-nfs target
to more closely resemble the overcloud.yaml target, including swift
and ssl templates as needed. The default BLOCKSTORAGESCALE is 1.
Change this number to add additional block storage nodes.

Change-Id: Ifcc733cfbf9f356393c3f6c72b2bbbb0214d3040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/79654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: overcloud-with-block-storage.yaml \overcloud.yaml: overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml swift-storage-source.yaml ssl-source.yaml $(overcloud_source_deps) python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py --scale NovaCompute=$${COMPUTESCALE:-'1'} --scale SwiftStorage=$${SWIFTSTORAGESCALE='0'} overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml swift-storage-source.yaml ssl-source.yaml > $@.tmpovercloud-with-block-storage.yaml: overcloud-source.yaml nova-compute-instance.yaml swift-source.yaml block-storage.yaml python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py --scale NovaCompute=$${COMPUTESCALE:-'1'} --scale BlockStorage=$${CINDERSCALE:-'1'} overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml block-storage.yaml > $@.tmp mv $@.tmp $@ overcloud-with-block-storage-nfs.yaml: overcloud-source.yaml nova-compute-instance.yaml swift-source.yaml nfs-server-source.yaml block-storage-nfs.yaml # $^ won't work here because we want to list nova-compute-instance.yaml as # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py --scale NovaCompute=$${COMPUTESCALE:-'1'} --scale BlockStorage=$${CINDERSCALE:-'1'} overcloud-source.yaml swift-source.yaml nfs-server-source.yaml block-storage-nfs.yaml > $@.tmp

commit_message:
Wait for keystone Service to start

Wait for 10 seconds trying to reach keystone service before
start climate-m. Added exception handling for ClimateException to
Climate Manager main.

commit_message:
Implement basic functionality of tiled App Catalog.

Implement both Index page and App Details page. Right now it uses fake
model application, but UI render part is complete.  There is no error
handling here yet, it should be added later.

Also basic image handling (for icons) is implemented:
* added images for app entries and details page.
* added image caching logic to store images on local disk.
* added Content-Cache header to cache images on client side too.

Partially implements: blueprint app-catalog-ui
Change-Id: Ibaff5b7805b6fa45906e6247619483af924889d9

commit_message:
Default value for database.connection config option

Before the code merge from review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76204/,
the default value for database.connection was (in
etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample):
    #connection=sqlite:////ironic/openstack/common/db/$sqlite_db

After the merge, there was no default value.

This sets the default to be the same value as before. 'sqlite_db'
needs to be in the DEFAULT group, in order to be used as a template
variable.

Change-Id: I8e8168cef0494e803857d43c3a837e13e3e494fb
Closes-Bug: #1290645

commit_message:
pin nose to 1.3.0

Nose 1.3.1 introduces a problem that causes tests to fail under python
3, which is preventing any changes in oslo-incubator. Stick with 1.3.0
until another release is available.

https://github.com/nose-devs/nose/commit/c51ff6ffda7e8b36eaa1152090e6238479610d7d

Change-Id: If3f6487f56cb8fc08ffe55fcf7bb5eca43d0ac2f

commit_message:
Add shelve_offload test for Nova API

On compute nodes which are configured with shelved_offload_time = -1,
the shelve API changes a server status to SHELVED and a server image
remains in the node. The shelve_offload API offloads the server image
from the node. This patch adds the API test for Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: Iaa2f94c3381c8b68df7fe132e1c13b4b81962b8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/89/74689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for negative tests with admin client

This adds the missing support for admin clients and implements an
example based on flavor creation. Instead of listing all result code
checks it is now possible to define on default.

Change-Id: I9512c1b91eb227e35faf24e3e88ed73a6ed3b734
Partially-implements: bp autogen-negative-tests

commit_message:
Do not restart libvirt if n-cpu is disabled

If this service is disable in localrc, libvirt does not installed at all,
and should not be restarted.

Change-Id: Iaf482d4a82a26546c25249b3e32c7e629d862a1b
Closes: bug 1288236

commit_message:
add check to create ~/.ssh/ to install-dependencies

The script breaks if ran on a fresh install without
a $HOME/.ssh/ directory. So let's make sure we have one.
Additionally, don't create (and set the mode of) one if
one already exists

Change-Id: Id7a2ef668ee31f00ecccb08a2b888f94ffbac06f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/45/77445/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # generate ssh key directory if it doesn't exist if [ ! -d ~/.ssh/ ]; then mkdir ~/.ssh fi

commit_message:
Fix gettextutil.Message handling of deep copy failures

Broadened deep copy exception handling and changed the keyword
dictionary deep copy to doing each element separately so that only
the failing dictionary item is converted to unicode.

Also added test cases.

Closes-bug: #1290468
Change-Id: I15f3880b32bec55bb61d96af41762c98486a274d

commit_message:
Make mongo install for ceilometer NOPRIME

mongodb packages are missing on some platforms, so we switch to a
manual install.  Also gate the mongo call in cleanup

Change-Id: I1755e461c66be30da3db2a0994f908503c4c38ea

commit_message:
Pecan TransactionHook was added

All actions that were implemented on ExceptionHandlingHook and
SessionHook were moved to CustomTransanctionalHook which introduces more
flexible way to manage db communications while request processing via
pecan.

Change-Id: I8ab20b4be30d307b3c25fff27dc774209c8522ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/63/77163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CustomTransactionalHook(hooks.TransactionHook): self.session = orm.scoped_session(orm.sessionmaker()) def start(): self.session.bind = self.engine def commit(): self.session.commit() def rollback(): self.session.rollback() def clear(): #not all GET controllers doesn't write to db self.session.commit() self.session.remove() super(CustomTransactionalHook, self).__init__(start, start, commit, rollback, clear) super(CustomTransactionalHook, self).before(state) state.request.session = self.session def on_error(self, state, exc): super(CustomTransactionalHook, self).on_error(state, exc)
deleted_lines: class ExceptionHandling(hooks.PecanHook): def on_error(self, state, e): LOG.exception('Pecan state %r', state) class SessionHook(hooks.PecanHook): state.request.session = orm.Session(bind=self.engine) def after(self, state): try: state.request.session.commit() except Exception: state.request.session.rollback() raise finally: state.request.session.close() def on_error(self, state, e): state.session.rollback() state.session.close()

commit_message:
Complete session hadling refactoring

All parts of system have been refactored. Session creation has been
simplified. Now session is created only when it is desperately needed and
its using is maximized instead of uncontrollable producing for each and
every block of code which is supposed to communicate with db.

This refactoring simplifies db data transfer management and makes it
more explicit for further developing.

Unit and functional tests have been updated.

Change-Id: I15a980432f9da5cac5f04b1f4f4af64d1a002b60

commit_message:
Modify assert statement when comparing with None

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in heat's
tests to have more clear messages in case of failure.
Also, replace assertNotEqual(None, *) with assertIsNotNone
for the same reason.

Change-Id: I34dbf9b87c7c8c6ca4949b53bd5ef763a9c2fc24
Closes-Bug: #1280522

commit_message:
Fix missing package dependency for requests

The package named requests is used by NetApp eseries
driver for doing client/server communications. This entry
is absent in requirements.txt. The patch fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1291325

Change-Id: I044ecce433d3d9e0409762a3e4551e1ce17f607d

commit_message:
Make heat stack-create waits fail fast

Updates the devtest_overcloud.sh and devtest_undercloud.sh
scripts so that our stack-ready command loops are fail fast.
This should avoid having end users and CI runs hit the
wait timeout before we discover that an error has occurred.

Change-Id: Ib23d8e127570a9fe80affa93be68f7cc9815a610

commit_message:
Add puppet-3.4 support

Adding puppet-3.4 support. It also should work under puppet-2.7.
In order to work properly with puppet-3.4 also requires some updates
in packages:
- ruby-rgen >= 0.6.5
- hiera >= 1.3.1

Change-Id: I40ffb6961e2b6de8090040f545648143e926872d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 21:34:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bce6254160f8396e8c09e71c9351507413200f30', 'message': "Ensure is_image_available handles V2 Glance API

The V2 Glance API uses warlock to validate returned models
from calls such as GET /images/{id}. The get_locations() call in
the Nova Glance image driver was using the V2 Glance API call
to GET /images/{id} (which is correct, since image locations only
exist in the V2 API), but the GlanceImageService._is_image_available()
method was checking the is_public attribute of the supplied image model.

an attribute on the V2 API's returned image model in glanceclient.
This change adds some checks that can handle both the V2 and V1 returned
image models from glanceclient and a bunch of unit tests to thoroughly
exercise the is_image_available method.

commit_message:
Ensure is_image_available handles V2 Glance API

The V2 Glance API uses warlock to validate returned models
from calls such as GET /images/{id}. The get_locations() call in
the Nova Glance image driver was using the V2 Glance API call
to GET /images/{id} (which is correct, since image locations only
exist in the V2 API), but the GlanceImageService._is_image_available()
method was checking the is_public attribute of the supplied image model.

This caused warlock to throw an exception since is_public is not
an attribute on the V2 API's returned image model in glanceclient.
This change adds some checks that can handle both the V2 and V1 returned
image models from glanceclient and a bunch of unit tests to thoroughly
exercise the is_image_available method.

Change-Id: I35b5af8331c5972bd89e1a674091fa2e3bde28a7
Closes-bug: #1291014
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/79780/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestIsImageAvailable(test.NoDBTestCase): """Tests the internal _is_image_available method on the Glance service.""" def test_auth_token_override(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=True) img = mock.MagicMock() res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) img.assert_not_called() def test_admin_override(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True) img = mock.MagicMock() res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) img.assert_not_called() def test_v2_visibility(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=False) # We emulate warlock validation that throws an AttributeError # if you try to call is_public on an image model returned by # a call to V2 image.get() img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=AttributeError, visibility='PUBLIC') res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) def test_v1_is_public(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True) img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=True, visibility=False) res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) def test_project_is_owner(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True, owner_id='123') props = { 'owner_id': '123' } img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=False, visibility=False, properties=props) res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) def test_project_context_matches_project_prop(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True, project_id='123') props = { 'project_id': '123' } img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=False, visibility=False, properties=props) res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res) def test_no_user_in_props(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True, project_id='123') props = { } img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=False, visibility=False, properties=props) res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertFalse(res) def test_user_matches_context(self): ctx = mock.MagicMock(auth_token=False, is_admin=True, user_id='123') props = { } img = mock.MagicMock(is_public=False, visibility=False, properties=props) res = glance.GlanceImageService._is_image_available(ctx, img) self.assertTrue(res)

commit_message:
Remove Duplicate Rabbit Parameters

This patch removes the duplicate rabbit username and password
parameters.  These parameters cause a conflict when running
merge.py because they already exist in the overcloud template.

Change-Id: I01d386577734c7c516a477e1e402882294ac4376

commit_message:
Use github as default GIT_BASE

git.openstack.org doesn't have a copy of noVNC lying around, and the way
stable/havana devstack works, it will end up checkout master nova repo
instead of stable/havana.

Even if devstack stable/havana cannot cd into a repo it still calls git
checkout.

Change-Id: I5cfb5f6f702fbe9e80fe02a897735c5f96bae3c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/80/79980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I5cc0a782cdc5914e250ae5176aa8a724b797a934

commit_message:
Add deletion of floating ip after disassociation

First problem - we have 2 very simmilar tests
that differs only by 1 step. In this patch
this 2 tests merge into 1.

Second one - during the tests we do not release
floating ip, we just disassociate it,
and release only in teardown(
when all tests from suite were executed).To fix this issue
add floating ip deleteion as a separate step

Change-Id: I5cc0a782cdc5914e250ae5176aa8a724b797a934
Closes-bug: #1288547

commit_message:
Fix unit tests running unnecessarily slow

Mocked/reduced various sleeps that got triggered on certain tests that
caused the tests to run unnecessary slow.

Closes-Bug: #1286729
Change-Id: Ib24be3d9aaa2b71d137ae4f0a9adc4986a49bdca

commit_message:
Add default user_identity to logging record

Just like instance and color formatting parameters we can't assume that
the user_identity will always be in the logging record. This patch adds
a default value for it if missing to avoid exceptions.

Change-Id: Id02902adb2579d44f1f4f066757ef3855b5ece87
Closes-Bug: #1290503

commit_message:
Set 'period', 'duration' config parameters in seconds

Parameters 'period' and 'duration' from task config for periodic
and coninuous runners, respectively, are set in seconds, according
to docstring. However, in code they are multiplied by 60 and thus
effectively set minutes, not seconds. This change is intended to
restore the consistency of code.

bug #1285074

Change-Id: I7617f6b59d3768ee7b280c48fdf70d6d60eb3fec

commit_message:
Drop the os-svc-install -n -c options.

Updates os-svc-install so that we disallow the -n and -c options.

Also, corrects the optargs for -h so that it doesn't take a parameter.
And fix some variable bound issues that could occur if the script
was executed with invalid args.

Change-Id: I4eb26fe6793aa1ad19b1dddc63a5f399e17a8325
Closes-bug: #1285283

commit_message:
Stop using the os-svc-install -n -c options.

We are repeatedly using the -n and -c options which don't
do anything. This removes the use of the unused options.

Partial-bug: #1285283

Change-Id: Ie67f3dfc1461ad41dcf130122902d4f1325e38ba

Add pep257 checker and flake8 plugin to check (and
maybe eventually gate) on PEP-257 rules for
docstrings.

The hacking guide defers to PEP-257 for
docstrings, but projects done' currently check for
that.

We're adding this to satori checks and gates (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79013/) and we've
got our tests working. This will allow us to
demonstrate that we can check and gate on PEP-257
compatibility (alongside the hacking plugin).

- Projects are active; we just got some patches
merged in.
- They are python 3.x compatible.

- pep257 is MIT licensed. the flake8 plugin has
  a custom, but open license.
- The packages are available on pypi.

commit_message:
Add PEP-257 Testing Tools

Add pep257 checker and flake8 plugin to check (and
maybe eventually gate) on PEP-257 rules for
docstrings.

The hacking guide defers to PEP-257 for
docstrings, but projects done' currently check for
that.

We're adding this to satori checks and gates (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/79013/) and we've
got our tests working. This will allow us to
demonstrate that we can check and gate on PEP-257
compatibility (alongside the hacking plugin).

- Projects are active; we just got some patches
merged in.
- They are python 3.x compatible.
- pep257 and the flake8 plugin have MIT licenses.
- The packages are available on pypi.

Change-Id: I7d8b9510e055dbeb77a60a382e67a0e0a3c2787b

commit_message:
Improve Ironic Conductor threading & locks

Ironic Conductor is not consistently using worker threads and
locks as it should.  Instead, it should be using greenthreads
where appropriate to spawn off tasks so that Conductor is freed
up.  This patch corrects do_node_tear_down().

Change-Id: Ia707766855bd7ec47a5af05e119b126504ddc0b1
Partial-Bug: #1285507

commit_message:
sql backend throwing DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message

BaseException.message has been deprecated. i'm inclined to believe
that args[0] is the correct alternative as even sqlalchemy appears
to use it for their own exceptions:

https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/1af8e2491dcbed723d2cdafd44fd37f1a6908e91/lib/sqlalchemy/exc.py

Change-Id: Ic0a9087c94c9ee494c63def6d78e06fe3475d325
Partial-Bug: #1257530

added_lines: for pattern in _DUP_KEY_RE_DB[engine_name]: match = pattern.match(integrity_error.args[0]) m = re.match(operational_error.args[0])
deleted_lines: # FIXME(johannes): The usage of the .message attribute has been # deprecated since Python 2.6. However, the exceptions raised by # SQLAlchemy can differ when using unicode() and accessing .message. # An audit across all three supported engines will be necessary to # ensure there are no regressions. for pattern in _DUP_KEY_RE_DB[engine_name]: match = pattern.match(integrity_error.message) # FIXME(johannes): The usage of the .message attribute has been # deprecated since Python 2.6. commit_message:
Add repeatable single ostf tests

To get possibility execute single ostf test
n times new test was added:
* deploy simple nova vlan, by default execute 50
  times test for verification public connectivity
  by floating ip
* deploy simple nova flat, by default execute 50
  times test for verification public connectivity
  by floating ip

Also there is possibility to change count of execution
and tests that should be invoked by environment
variables

Change-Id: Id7b09ccf7c398262f7ec3ebcbd222f349be95fc6

commit_message:
Fix excessive logging from db.sqlalchemy.session

A message about the MySQL server mode was logged at the info level
every time a connection was checked out. This happens often, and
logging every time is unnecessary.

Here's an example of the message when using the default
configuration:

 MySQL server mode set to STRICT_TRANS_TABLES,STRICT_ALL_TABLES,...

The fix is to send the message once per engine creation. Also,
this message is now logged the debug level since there's a warning
logged if the mode isn't a "safe" one already.

Closes-Bug: #1288443
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I13b24d04c28e69a8534aaa8d3a4463ca1d65570f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/41/78441/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add lockutils fixture to OpportunisticTestCase

We're getting hit hard with db race problems right now and the
proper fix can't go in until infra has all of their regions
updated.  Using the lock fixture to serialize all of the db tests
should help with the problem until infra is ready.

Change-Id: If883832b0eba08f1508a247310b8eebd67b27971
Partial-Bug: #1288916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/55/79655/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.common.fixture import lockutils # TODO(bnemec): Remove this once the separate db schemas change is # working in all of our infra regions. self.useFixture(lockutils.LockFixture('opportunistic-db'))

subject: Make yum install ignore missing packages if architecture is ppc64
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-10 16:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/78951ef619590425652a22bf6d99c957b232fac1', 'message': "Make yum install ignore missing packages if architecture is ppc64

There's a few packages missing in ppc64 architecture.
The latest patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/77067
Broken the devstack in ppc64 due the check if there's
missed packages.
This patch check if the architecture is ppc64 if so
uses the old way, just with yum install -y.
Otherwise, it will use the new check.

Change-Id: I3fd4aeaf183b8def787ba677f8941bf52e5d1b53
"}]
commit_message:
Make yum install ignore missing packages if architecture is ppc64

There's a few packages missing in ppc64 architecture.
The latest patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/77067
Broken the devstack in ppc64 due the check if there's
missed packages.
This patch check if the architecture is ppc64 if so
uses the old way, just with yum install -y.
Otherwise, it will use the new check.

Change-Id: I3fd4aeaf183b8def787ba677f8941bf52e5d1b53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/56/79356/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # PowerPC have some missing packages like mongo-db, we # don't want to kill the yum if it's running in # ppc64 architecture if is_arch "ppc64" then $sudo http_proxy=$http_proxy https_proxy=$https_proxy \ no_proxy=$no_proxy \ yum install -y "$@" else # The manual check for missing packages is because yum -y assumes # missing packages are OK. See # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=965567 $sudo http_proxy=$http_proxy https_proxy=$https_proxy \ no_proxy=$no_proxy \ yum install -y "$@" 2>&1 | \ awk ' BEGIN { fail=0 } /No package/ { fail=1 } { print } END { exit fail }' || \ die $LINENO "Missing packages detected" # also ensure we catch a yum failure if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "Yum install failure" fi
deleted_lines: # The manual check for missing packages is because yum -y assumes # missing packages are OK. See # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=965567 $sudo http_proxy=$http_proxy https_proxy=$https_proxy \ no_proxy=$no_proxy \ yum install -y "$@" 2>&1 | \ awk ' BEGIN { fail=0 } /No package/ { fail=1 } { print } END { exit fail }' || \ die $LINENO "Missing packages detected" # also ensure we catch a yum failure if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "Yum install failure"

Using python setup.py --name instead of the current working
directory will allow the config generator to work correctly by
default even if the local source tree was cloned into a directory

Change-Id: Iea529e7e691d94402f658e7095387dc3e98e32fe
Closes-Bug: #1288417
"}]
commit_message:
Be smarter about config generator default package name

Using python setup.py --name instead of the current working
directory will allow the config generator to work correctly by
default even if the local source tree was cloned into a directory
that doesn't match the project name.

Change-Id: Iea529e7e691d94402f658e7095387dc3e98e32fe
Closes-Bug: #1288417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/29/79429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PACKAGENAME=${PACKAGENAME:-$(python setup.py --name)}

commit_message:
VMware: ensure that deprecation does not appear for VC driver

Commit d041b95b8977e77a51e6031c38f0011b44d3266a added the
deprecation warning for the ESX driver. This warning should
not appear for the VC driver.

Change-Id: Ide7b47afbd9e7e4c66a4cdc621fbf511b9c3c953
Closes-bug: #1291238

commit_message:
Don't raise exception if deploy_id not found

Currently envutuils.default_deployment_id raises an exception if there
is no active deployment (one that has been recorded previously with use
ore create). This patch changes the method to return None instead.

Change-Id: I57052e5d4862d80b95a45eb582702ce009a4f22f
Closes-Bug: #1291298
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/05/79905/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: current_deploy_id = envutils.default_deployment_id() except exceptions.InvalidArgumentsException: # NOTE(hughsaunders): no active deployment current_deploy_id = None

commit_message:
Fix compute_node stats

The compute_node object has several issues with the stats field
that are cleaned up by this patch, including the following:

- obj_make_compatible() should check the stats property exists
  before attempting to delete it
- from_db_object() should not create the stats property if it
  is not in the database field (it is a nullable field)
- create() should convert the stats property to its database
  field format if it is present
- tests for create() and save() should check that the database
  format conversion is done

This method does not change any fields so there is no change to
the object's version.

Change-Id: I5c68994d618f0ecf9409c37321bc87a006c431ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/79095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import jsonutilsfake_stats = {'num_foo': '10'} fake_stats_db_format = jsonutils.dumps(fake_stats) 'stats': fake_stats_db_format, } db.compute_node_create( self.context, { 'service_id': 456, 'stats': fake_stats_db_format }).AndReturn(fake_compute_node) compute.stats = fake_stats db.compute_node_update( self.context, 123, { 'vcpus_used': 3, 'stats': fake_stats_db_format }).AndReturn(fake_compute_node) compute.stats = fake_stats

commit_message:
Verify more information in API tests for LBaaS

In API tests for LBaaS not all information is checked  that is
required.
For example, test_show_* checks only equality of name and id;
test_associate_disassociate_health_monitor_with_pool does not check
that pool containts healthmonitor after assosiating.

This tests should be corrected.

Also create_member and update_member was updated to use _create and
_update from network_client_base.

Closes-bug: #1262112

Change-Id: I352253ce9e28b46324a81e40c6b86759e0687420
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/61118/23 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual(self.vip['protocol'], vip['protocol']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['subnet_id'], vip['subnet_id']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['pool_id'], vip['pool_id']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['protocol_port'], vip['protocol_port']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['port_id'], vip['port_id']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['tenant_id'], vip['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(self.vip['connection_limit'], vip['connection_limit']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['protocol'], pool['protocol']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['subnet_id'], pool['subnet_id']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['lb_method'], pool['lb_method']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['provider'], pool['provider']) self.assertEqual(self.pool['tenant_id'], pool['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(self.member['protocol_port'], member['protocol_port']) self.assertEqual(self.member['pool_id'], member['pool_id']) self.assertEqual(self.member['address'], member['address']) self.assertEqual(self.member['tenant_id'], member['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(self.health_monitor['delay'], health_monitor['delay']) self.assertEqual(self.health_monitor['max_retries'], health_monitor['max_retries']) self.assertEqual(self.health_monitor['type'], health_monitor['type']) self.assertEqual(self.health_monitor['pools'], health_monitor['pools']) self.assertEqual(self.health_monitor['timeout'], health_monitor['timeout']) resp, body = self.client.show_health_monitor( self.health_monitor['id']) health_monitor = body['health_monitor'] resp, body = self.client.show_pool(self.pool['id']) pool = body['pool'] self.assertEqual(pool['id'], health_monitor['pools'][0]['pool_id']) self.assertIn(health_monitor['id'], pool['health_monitors'])

subject: Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-22 16:27:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/352b9c381e98c19b4a884fd4156564837c18d81b', 'message': 'Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during certain REBOOT-*
operations then the instance will be left stuck in a transitional
task_state

This change handles two possible task states REBOOT_PENDING and
REBOOT_STARTED (for both soft and hard reboots). And either clears
these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f

these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f

commit_message:
Recover from REBOOT-* state on compute manager start-up

If a compute manager is stopped / fails during certain REBOOT-*
operations then the instance will be left stuck in a transitional
task_state

This change handles two possible task states REBOOT_PENDING and
REBOOT_STARTED (for both soft and hard reboots). And either clears
these states or retries the reboot depending on the instance state.

Both task states are set after the request has gotten to the compute
manager so we can handle these safely knowing the operation has
ended/failed with the restart of the compute manager.

We retry the reboot where the state is PENDING and where the state is
STARTED and the instance is not running.

Where the instance is running and the state is STARTED we simply
transition the instance to an ACTIVE state. The user can retry the
reboot if required.

Related to blueprint recover-stuck-state

Change-Id: Ib318b3d444a67616441302f3daa8de20ee946f3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/57967/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: updated_dbinstance3 = fake_instance.fake_db_instance( **dict(uuid='updated-instance2', power_state=10003, vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, launched_at=timeutils.utcnow())) task_pending = (soft and task_states.REBOOT_PENDING or task_states.REBOOT_PENDING_HARD) task_started = (soft and task_states.REBOOT_STARTED or task_states.REBOOT_STARTED_HARD) db.instance_update_and_get_original(econtext, instance['uuid'], {'task_state': task_pending}, update_cells=False, columns_to_join=['system_metadata'] ).AndReturn((None, db_instance)) db.instance_update_and_get_original(econtext, updated_dbinstance1['uuid'], {'task_state': task_started}, update_cells=False, columns_to_join=['system_metadata'] ).AndReturn((None, updated_dbinstance1))

commit_message:
Improve compatibility between Keystone V2 and V3

To improve compatibility between Keystone V2 and V3, this renames the
client @property in both of them from self.client_v2 and self.client_v3
to just self.client.

This allows both of them to be used by third party contrib plugins in a
seamless manner.

Closes-Bug: 1289528
Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I60412ecb1665232ffeeeb869fb00d368604601d2

deleted_lines: # The vendor content types should serialize identically to the non-vendor # content types. Change-Id: I50b760ec24a67900f80d961f738d5fd7643561bc
'}]
commit_message:
policy: rename Exception to avoid nose regression

The name TestException makes nose think that this is a test case, so it
fails with nose 1.3.1. Renaming the exception thinks that problem.

commit_message:
Bug 1273273 :if run 'keystone-manage db_sync' without 'sudo', there should be a prompt that tables not created

The bug fix is to raise a more user-friendly exception if keystone.conf cannot be read

Fixes Bug1273273

Change-Id: I1f28a5561e051e9d5775691f217320b926699ec6

The error message for the exception is:
(IntegrityError) UNIQUE constrait failed: table.column ....
The fix is to add the string "unique constraint failed" when looking

Closes-Bug: 1290560
Change-Id: Id8e28443cf238a888e780f38f983129e5ac1d2f0
'}]
commit_message:
create_server fails if server is not unique

The error message for the exception is:
(IntegrityError) UNIQUE constrait failed: table.column ....
The fix is to add the string "unique constraint failed" when looking
for IntegrityErrors to convert to exceptions.Duplicates.
Closes-Bug: 1290560
Change-Id: Id8e28443cf238a888e780f38f983129e5ac1d2f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/55/79455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'not unique', 'unique constraint failed'

commit_message:
Add plan_uuid to the assembly api model

In the current API state, it is not possible to create an assembly
other than parsing the plan_uri field, we should be able to pass
the plan uuid during the creation.

Change-Id: I718036a09e4d621e7e0b35a46c2e0a8236501f10

commit_message:
moves default keystone API to v3

v2.0 of the keystone API was deprecated in icehouse-2, moving to
support v3 by default.

This also fixes a bug in Horizon where if you specify v3 for the
API version and v2.0 is still the auth url, login fails.

Implements blueprint keystone-v3-default
Partial-bug: #1267636

Change-Id: Ibc4872f24125fa74230eab781b002dffdba5f5da

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/07/75007/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonschema """Validate a given data with a given schema. :param data: a data to validate represented as a dict :param schema: a schema to validate represented as a dict; must be in JSON Schema Draft 4 format. """ try: checker = jsonschema.FormatChecker() jsonschema.validate(data, schema, format_checker=checker) except Exception as exc: # We need to cast a given exception to the string since it's the # only way to print readable validation error. Unfortunately, # jsonschema has no base class for exceptions, so we don't know # about internal attributes with error description. raise errors.InvalidData(str(exc))
deleted_lines: from jsonschema import validate try: validate(data, schema) except Exception as exc: raise errors.InvalidData(exc.message)

commit_message:
Ui test for Stop/Reset actions

Change-Id: I674051d9882d85d1efb696afd55a58e56693fdfc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/22/76822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* * Copyright 2013 Mirantis, Inc. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. **/ casper.start(); casper.createCluster({name: 'Test Cluster'}); var nodes = [ {status: 'discover', manufacturer: 'Dell', mac: 'C0:8D:DF:52:76:F1'} ]; nodes.forEach(function(node) { casper.createNode(node); }); casper.loadPage('#cluster/1/nodes').waitForSelector('#tab-nodes > *'); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing cluster page'); this.test.assertExists('.deployment-control .deploy-btn.disabled', 'Deploy changes button is disabled'); this.test.assertExists('.cluster-toolbar .btn-configure-disks:disabled', 'Button Configure Disks is disabled'); this.test.assertExists('.cluster-toolbar .btn-configure-interfaces:disabled', 'Button Configure Interfaces is disabled'); this.test.assertExists('.cluster-toolbar .btn-add-nodes:not(:disabled)', 'Add Nodes button is enabled'); this.test.assertEvalEquals(function() {return $('.node-box').length}, 0, 'Number of available nodes is correct'); }); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing adding node with controller role'); this.click('.cluster-toolbar .btn-add-nodes'); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.roles-panel', 'Add controller nodes screen appears'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertEvalEquals(function() {return $('.node-box .node-content').length}, 1, 'Number of unallocated nodes is correct'); this.evaluate(function() { $('input[name="controller"]').click(); // check the controller role $('.node-checkbox input[type=checkbox]').click(); // check one node }); this.click('.btn-apply'); }); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.cluster-toolbar .btn-add-nodes', 'Return to nodes tab'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertEvalEquals(function() {return $('.node-box').length}, 1, 'Number of available roles is correct'); this.test.assertExists('.deployment-control .deploy-btn:not(.disabled)', 'Deploy changes button is enabled now'); }); }); casper.loadPage('#cluster/1/actions').waitForSelector('#tab-actions > *'); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing Reset button exist and disabled'); this.test.assertExists('.action-item-controls .reset-environment-btn:disabled', 'Reset button exist and disabled'); }); casper.loadPage('#cluster/1/nodes').waitForSelector('#tab-nodes > *'); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing stop deployment'); this.test.assertExists('.deployment-control .deploy-btn:not(.disabled)', 'Deploy changes button is enabled'); this.click('.deployment-control .deploy-btn'); // "Deploy changes" button click this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.modal', 'Deployment dialog opens'); this.then(function() { this.click('.modal .start-deployment-btn'); // "Start Deployment" button click }); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.modal', 'Deployment dialog closes after clicking Start Deployment'); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.deployment-control .deploy-btn', 'Deploy changes button disappears'); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.deployment-control .progress-success', 'Deployment progress-success bar appears'); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.deployment-control .stop-deployment-btn', 'Stop deployment button appears'); this.then(function() { this.click('.deployment-control .stop-deployment-btn'); // "Stop Deployment" button click }); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.modal', 'Stop Deployment dialog opens'); this.then(function() { this.click('.modal .stop-deployment-btn'); // "Stop Deployment" on modal screen button click }); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.modal', 'Stop deployment dialog closes after clicking Stop button'); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.deployment-control .progress-striped', 'Deployment progress-stopping bar appears'); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.deployment-control .progress-striped', 'Deployment progress-stopping bar disappears', 60000); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.deployment-control .deploy-btn:not(.disabled)', 'Deploy changes button is enabled again'); this.test.assertExists('.alert-success', 'Success stopping deployment alert message appears'); }); }); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing Tabs locking after deployment stop'); var countIsReadyNodes = this.evaluate(function() { // get count of Nodes with Ready status return $('.node-box.ready').length; }); if ( countIsReadyNodes > 0) { // there are ready nodes, we should check that "Network" and "Settings" tab are locked this.test.comment('- there are ready nodes in the list'); this.loadPage('#cluster/1/network').waitForSelector('#tab-network > *'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.network-settings.changes-locked', 'Network Tab is Locked'); }); this.loadPage('#cluster/1/settings').waitForSelector('#tab-settings > *'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.openstack-settings.changes-locked', 'Settings Tab is Locked'); }); // TODO: add "Health Check" Tab checking - it should be Unlocked in this scenario } else { // there are no ready nodes, we should check that "Network" and "Settings" tab are unlocked this.test.comment('- there are no ready nodes in the list'); this.loadPage('#cluster/1/network').waitForSelector('#tab-network > *'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.network-settings:not(.changes-locked)', 'Network Tab is unlocked'); }); this.loadPage('#cluster/1/settings').waitForSelector('#tab-settings > *'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.openstack-settings:not(.changes-locked)', 'Settings Tab is unlocked'); }); // TODO: add "Health Check" Tab checking - it should be locked in this scenario } }); casper.loadPage('#cluster/1/actions').waitForSelector('#tab-actions > *'); casper.then(function() { this.test.comment('Testing Reset button'); this.test.assertExists('.action-item-controls .reset-environment-btn:not(:disabled)', 'Reset button exist and enabled after stopped deployment'); this.click('.action-item-controls .reset-environment-btn'); // "Reset" button click this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.modal', 'Reset dialog opens'); this.then(function() { this.click('.modal .reset-environment-btn'); // "Reset environment" button click }); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.modal', 'Reset dialog closes after clicking Reset button'); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.deployment-control .deploy-btn', 'Deploy changes button disappears'); this.test.assertSelectorAppears('.deployment-control .progress-striped', 'Reset progress bar appears'); this.test.assertSelectorDisappears('.deployment-control .progress-striped', 'Reset progress bar disappears', 60000); this.test.assertExists('.deployment-control .deploy-btn:not(.disabled)', 'Deploy changes button is enabled again'); this.test.assertExists('.alert-success', 'Success reset message appears'); this.test.assertEvalEquals(function() {return $('.node-box.ready').length}, 0, 'Number of ready nodes is correct'); this.loadPage('#cluster/1/actions').waitForSelector('#tab-actions > *'); this.then(function() { this.test.assertExists('.action-item-controls .reset-environment-btn:disabled', 'Reset button is disabled after successful reset'); }); }); casper.run(function() { this.test.done(); });

commit_message:
Fix get_download_hander() typo

Clearly, this was meant to be get_download_handler().

Refactor loading modules in GlanceImageService a little to avoid the
get_download_handler() going over the length-of-line limit.

Change-Id: If871413cbb86cd800be8517bb37932df890bf53d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/79309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for scheme, mod in download_modules.iteritems(): if scheme not in CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes: continue try: self._download_handlers[scheme] = mod.get_download_handler() except Exception as ex: msg = _('When loading the module %(module_str)s the ' 'following error occurred: %(ex)s')\ % {'module_str': str(mod), 'ex': ex} LOG.error(msg)
deleted_lines: for scheme in download_modules: if scheme in CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes: mod = download_modules[scheme] try: self._download_handlers[scheme] = mod.get_download_hander() except Exception as ex: msg = _('When loading the module %(module_str)s the ' 'following error occurred: %(ex)s')\ % {'module_str': str(mod), 'ex': ex} LOG.error(msg)

commit_message:
Added eventlet connections pool for SQL

Connections pooling is needed because the collector only ever grabs
one connection to the database at a time. this causes a massive
backlog on the message queue.

reuses Change-Id: I5ccdc141c441db32fab361783a31a96015516878

Change-Id: I8b2f70516e03c5a2fab0042e2640b1e3f4942a30
Closes-Bug: #1291054

commit_message:
Make savanna able to be executed/used as sahara

* add endpoint alias for cli;
* add saharaclient package with link to the savanna client.

In future we'll remove savanna endpoints.

commit_message:
Make savanna able to be executed as sahara

* read config files from sahara places;
* add endpoint aliases for api and db-amange.

In future we'll remove savanna endpoints.

Change-Id: I585be8141bf9515c9b1679847ffb2ab3c153967f

added_lines: # TODO(slukjanov): remove this code (temp to migrate to the new name) if conf_files is None: conf_files = [] conf_files += cfg.find_config_files(project="sahara")

commit_message:
Use stack ID to create domain project name

If the project for a given stack didn't get deleted for any reason then
launching a stack with the same name will fail as project names
are enforced to be unique.

By using the stack ID instead this issue is avoided if the project delete
didn't occur.

The resulting project name is truncated to the limit of 64.

Change-Id: Iba09cf94bdaa6a92d9520ed1743805862dc1b14d
Closes-Bug: #1288514

commit_message:
Remove copyright from empty files

According to policy change in HACKING:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing
empty files should no longer contain copyright notices.

Change-Id: I5745cf1963f442adc7de2e0f54a3ea39d7bc8edd

commit_message:
Add more NICs to nodes in sample_environment.json

Some nodes in sample_environment.json contains only one NIC. So if somebody
tries to run fake deploy process he'll fail because of error:

    Some untagged networks are assigned to the same physical interface.
    You should assign them to different physical interfaces

Since now, all the nodes have at least two NICs.

Change-Id: I2901809063701a89f2f7bcd5a419e97759580da3
Closes-Bug: #1271129

commit_message:
Fix small misuse of cast within oslo.messaging wrapper

cast() method doesn't return a value, the wrapper should do the same
accordingly.

See https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging#Client_Side_API

Change-Id: I8ab6f77fbb622134e434660c2a662ea08474e51f

commit_message:
VMware: image cache aging

The current patch set deletes cached images that are no longer used.
Images that are unused will be marked for aging. These images
will be deleted after they have not been used for
'remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds'.

The third and final phase of blueprint vmware-image-cache-management.

NOTE: in order to ensure that there will not be race conditions with
multiple compute nodes, each compute node will have its own datastore
cache directory. This will be a combination of the configuration
variables my_ip and image_cache_subdirectory_name. If the aging is
disabled then the original base is used (ensures backwards
compatibility).

Locking is done when accessing timestamps to detect if an image has aged
in the cache.

Change-Id: Iec47c28a38761c187226c5eff3ab69da503437f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/56416/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_allowed_datastores(data_stores, datastore_regex, allowed_types): allowed = [] for obj_content in data_stores.objects: # the propset attribute "need not be set" by returning API if not hasattr(obj_content, 'propSet'): continue propdict = propset_dict(obj_content.propSet) # Local storage identifier vSphere doesn't support CIFS or # vfat for datastores, therefore filtered ds_type = propdict['summary.type'] ds_name = propdict['summary.name'] if (propdict['summary.accessible'] and ds_type in allowed_types): if datastore_regex is None or datastore_regex.match(ds_name): allowed.append({'ref': obj_content.obj, 'name': ds_name}) return allowed def get_available_datastores(session, cluster=None, datastore_regex=None): """Get the datastore list and choose the first local storage.""" if cluster: mobj = cluster type = "ClusterComputeResource" else: mobj = get_host_ref(session) type = "HostSystem" ds = session._call_method(vim_util, "get_dynamic_property", mobj, type, "datastore") if not ds: return [] data_store_mors = ds.ManagedObjectReference data_stores = session._call_method(vim_util, "get_properties_for_a_collection_of_objects", "Datastore", data_store_mors, ["summary.type", "summary.name", "summary.accessible"]) allowed = [] while data_stores: allowed.extend(_get_allowed_datastores(data_stores, datastore_regex, ['VMFS', 'NFS'])) token = _get_token(data_stores) if not token: break data_stores = session._call_method(vim_util, "continue_to_get_objects", token) return allowed

subject: Refactor network_get_associated_fixed_ips() for sanity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 17:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ff2de00c4e387e7758b548a45685c1a9cc1dac53', 'message': 'Refactor network_get_associated_fixed_ips() for sanity

The network_get_associated_fixed_ips() db api method returns a
dict of randomness that is neither a model, nor a mapping to one.
In order to replace this method with an object call, we need to
make it do something a little more helpful.

This patch simply refactors it to return the same data, but in model
form that we can reasonably turn into an object in a later patch.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Related-bug: 1290568
Change-Id: Ia6bb88f51ed31fb3a48fc52670b978acf8a326dc
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor network_get_associated_fixed_ips() for sanity

The network_get_associated_fixed_ips() db api method returns a
dict of randomness that is neither a model, nor a mapping to one.
In order to replace this method with an object call, we need to
make it do something a little more helpful.

This patch simply refactors it to return the same data, but in model
form that we can reasonably turn into an object in a later patch.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Related-bug: 1290568
Change-Id: Ia6bb88f51ed31fb3a48fc52670b978acf8a326dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/79680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: query = model_query(context, models.FixedIp, models.Instance, models.VirtualInterface).\ filter(models.FixedIp.deleted == 0).\ filter(models.FixedIp.network_id == network_id).\ filter(models.FixedIp.allocated == True).\ join((models.VirtualInterface, vif_and)).\ join((models.Instance, inst_and)).\ filter(models.FixedIp.instance_uuid != None).\ filter(models.FixedIp.virtual_interface_id != None) # NOTE(danms): This returns a list of tuples that look like: # (FixedIp, Instance, VirtualInterface) return result
deleted_lines: # NOTE(vish): The ugly joins here are to solve a performance issue and # should be removed once we can add and remove leases # without regenerating the whole list session = get_session() query = session.query(models.FixedIp.address, models.FixedIp.instance_uuid, models.FixedIp.network_id, models.FixedIp.virtual_interface_id, models.VirtualInterface.address, models.Instance.hostname, models.Instance.updated_at, models.Instance.created_at, models.FixedIp.allocated, models.FixedIp.leased).\ filter(models.FixedIp.deleted == 0).\ filter(models.FixedIp.network_id == network_id).\ filter(models.FixedIp.allocated == True).\ join((models.VirtualInterface, vif_and)).\ join((models.Instance, inst_and)).\ filter(models.FixedIp.instance_uuid != None).\ filter(models.FixedIp.virtual_interface_id != None)

commit_message:
Add py27local tox target

This adds a new tox target that uses sitepackages=False. This is
handy for people running unit tests on a devstack box, where the
site-packages oslo.config interferes.

Change-Id: I1101730f18550de0b391d12bcc5841cb671434a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/79677/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:py27local] sitepackages = False

commit_message:
Rework proxy publish functionality

* Task uuid is not a required parameter now;
* Exchange declaration does not require a connection object.

Change-Id: I9a77c9afe7d9fad007902d77d24a0b1a96c6c519

commit_message:
Raise more information on V2 API volumes when resource not found

NotFound exception is caught in volumes.py on v2 api
and raise HTTPNotFound exception but exception information are
not well specified. This patch adds more information
to the raised exception.

Change-Id: I822011fa77004d1ca01e531842ba73e23317dabe
Closes-Bug: #1275755

commit_message:
Implements monitoring-network-from-opendaylight

This feture is driver of the monitoring-network that collects network
info from OpenDayLight via Statistics REST API, Toporogy REST API and
Switch Manager REST API.

Implements: blueprint monitoring-network-from-opendaylight

Change-Id: Id209a05dfc83500c4aaabdece7e44241853e07dc
